notes: The agility talent effectively grants Razor 1.5 armor, 9 attack speed, and 9 attack damage.
The health talent increases maximum health capacity, and keeps the current health percentage.
The strength talent effectively grants Razor 280 health and 1.4 health regeneration.
The armor talent does not benefit illusions.

talents.talentLeft: -0.1 Eye of the Storm Strike Interval

notes: Plasma Field interrupts Razor's channeling abilities upon cast.
Plasma Field expands and retracts at a speed of 636, taking a total of 2.2 seconds to fully expand and retract.
Plasma Field is centered on Razor for the full duration. Provides 700 radius flying vision during the 2.2-second effect, following Razor and leaving a trail of vision which lasts 2 seconds.
Provides 700 radius flying vision during the 2.2-second effect, following Razor and leaving a trail of vision which lasts 2 seconds.

Plasma Field's effect area is a 100 range wide annulus, a ring shape. The ring starts 105 range away from Razor and expands for up to 700 range, reaching a total distance of 805. Together with the damage width, it can hit units up to 905 range away.
The ring starts 105 range away from Razor and expands for up to 700 range, reaching a total distance of 805.
Together with the damage width, it can hit units up to 905 range away.
The visual effect starts at Razor's location and expands for the same distance. This means the visual effect is 105 range behind the damaging ring, and not centered on it.
This means the visual effect is 105 range behind the damaging ring, and not centered on it.

The damage and slow are applied upon expanding and upon retracting, so each enemy can be hit twice. The slow debuff fully stacks. This means it can deal up to 70/80/90/100 - 160/230/300/370 damage and slow for up to 10% - 50%/60%/70%/80% movement speed.
This means it can deal up to 70/80/90/100 - 160/230/300/370 damage and slow for up to 10% - 50%/60%/70%/80% movement speed.

The slow and damage values are based on how far the ring traveled, reaching max values at 805 range. 105 Distance: 35/40/45/50 damage and 5%/5%/5%/5% movement speed slow. 205 Distance: 41/51/60/69 damage and 8%/9%/9%/10% movement speed slow. 305 Distance: 48/61/75/89 damage and 11%/12%/14%/15% movement speed slow. 405 Distance: 54/72/90/108 damage and 14%/16%/18%/20% movement speed slow. 505 Distance: 61/83/105/127 damage and 16%/19%/22%/25% movement speed slow. 605 Distance: 67/94/120/146 damage and 19%/23%/26%/30% movement speed slow. 705 Distance: 74/104/135/166 damage and 22%/26%/31%/35% movement speed slow. 805 Distance: 80/115/150/185 damage and 25%/30%/35%/40% movement speed slow. 905 Distance: 80/115/150/185 damage and 25%/30%/35%/40% movement speed slow.
105 Distance: 35/40/45/50 damage and 5%/5%/5%/5% movement speed slow.
205 Distance: 41/51/60/69 damage and 8%/9%/9%/10% movement speed slow.
305 Distance: 48/61/75/89 damage and 11%/12%/14%/15% movement speed slow.
405 Distance: 54/72/90/108 damage and 14%/16%/18%/20% movement speed slow.
505 Distance: 61/83/105/127 damage and 16%/19%/22%/25% movement speed slow.
605 Distance: 67/94/120/146 damage and 19%/23%/26%/30% movement speed slow.
705 Distance: 74/104/135/166 damage and 22%/26%/31%/35% movement speed slow.
805 Distance: 80/115/150/185 damage and 25%/30%/35%/40% movement speed slow.
905 Distance: 80/115/150/185 damage and 25%/30%/35%/40% movement speed slow.
abilities.description: Releases a wave of energetic plasma that grows in power as it expands, but also zaps on contraction, slowing and dealing damage to enemy units caught in its path. Damage and slow increases with distance from Razor. The Plasma Field hits each unit twice, once each direction.
abilities.story: The Lightning Revenant rules the Underscape with plasmatic power.

notes: Static Link is broken when either unit dies or the link gets stretched more than 800 range. Nothing else can break the link. The distance between Razor and the target is checked right before each damage steal interval. If the distance is greater upon check, the link breaks. Since the link uses the ability's cast range, cast range increasing effects increase the link break distance as well.
The distance between Razor and the target is checked right before each damage steal interval. If the distance is greater upon check, the link breaks.
Since the link uses the ability's cast range, cast range increasing effects increase the link break distance as well.
Static Link provides shared vision over the target while draining.
Static Link keeps stealing damage even if the target's damage has reached 0.

Drains 1.75/3/4.25/5.5 (TagTalent 3/4.25/5.5/6.75) damage in 0.25-second intervals, starting 0.25 seconds after cast, resulting in 20/24/28/32 instances. Can steal up to 35/72/119/176 (TagTalent 60/102/154/216) damage when draining for the full duration.
Can steal up to 35/72/119/176 (TagTalent 60/102/154/216) damage when draining for the full duration.

Static Link orders Razor to attack the target upon cast, and upon each move order. Allows Razor to move while attacking the Static Link target. To not attack the target while moving, a unit-targeted order, or a ground-targeted order that is not a move or attack order must be given to Razor.
Allows Razor to move while attacking the Static Link target.
To not attack the target while moving, a unit-targeted order, or a ground-targeted order that is not a move or attack order must be given to Razor.
Can be cast on heroes, illusions and creep-heroes.

Multiple casts of Static Link stack with each other, each cast placing its own debuff on the target and buff on Razor. However, the vision modifier does not stack. It disappears as soon as the first link ends. Only the oldest linked target may be attacked while moving.
However, the vision modifier does not stack. It disappears as soon as the first link ends.
Only the oldest linked target may be attacked while moving.
abilities.description: Creates a charged link between Razor and an enemy Hero, stealing damage from the target and giving it to Razor. Allows razor to attack while moving with the link active.
abilities.story: Razor's polarity channels electricity into his being, draining the power of his opposition.

notes: With Aghanim's Shard, can only proc when an enemy unit lands an attack on Razor, regardless of distance. This means it cannot proc on missed attacks. Does not proc on attacks from buildings and wards. Can be procced by allied attacks. Doing so hits the proccing ally, but it still chooses enemies as secondary targets. Also triggers on every single-target ability that is cast on Razor, including ground-targeted abilities with unit-targeting option. This means it neither follows the Spell Reflection list, nor the Spell Block list. Projectile-based abilities trigger it on launch, not on impact.
Does not proc on attacks from buildings and wards.
Can be procced by allied attacks. Doing so hits the proccing ally, but it still chooses enemies as secondary targets.
Also triggers on every single-target ability that is cast on Razor, including ground-targeted abilities with unit-targeting option.
This means it neither follows the Spell Reflection list, nor the Spell Block list. Projectile-based abilities trigger it on launch, not on impact.
Storm Surge's effect is applied after the triggering ability takes effect. This means when the casting unit has low enough health to die to it, the triggering ability still takes effect.
This means when the casting unit has low enough health to die to it, the triggering ability still takes effect.

The search radius is centered around the triggering unit, not around Razor. The targets are choosen randomly, there are no priorities. If triggered by an attack, does not target invisible enemies or enemies inside the fog of war as secondary targets. If triggered by an ability, does target invisible enemies or enemies inside the fog of war.
The targets are choosen randomly, there are no priorities.
If triggered by an attack, does not target invisible enemies or enemies inside the fog of war as secondary targets.
If triggered by an ability, does target invisible enemies or enemies inside the fog of war.
Storm Surge first applies the damage, then the debuff.
Storm Surge's proc chance uses pseudo-random distribution.
params: Causes Storm Surge to have a 18% chance when attacked, and always when targeted with a spell, to release a forked lightning that strikes the target and up to 2 other enemies. Deals 150 damage and slows them by 50% for 1.5 seconds.
Forked lightning does not trigger if the source is spell immune. Does not target spell immune units as secondary targets.
Movement speed bonus and Forked Lightnings are disabled by Break.
Movement speed bonus works for illusions. Forked lightnings cannot be released by illusions.
abilities.story: Merely approaching the Lightning Revenant is rewarded with shock therapy.

notes: Interrupts Razor's channeling abilities upon cast.

Eye of the Storm always targets the unit with the lowest current health within the radius first. If there are multiple units with the same lowest health in range, Eye of the Storm chooses between them randomly. The storm prioritizes enemies which have the Static Link vision modifier on them, striking them over any other unit when within range, regardless of health values. When there are multiple enemies with the vision modifier within the radius, the storm chooses between them randomly on each strike.
If there are multiple units with the same lowest health in range, Eye of the Storm chooses between them randomly.
The storm prioritizes enemies which have the Static Link vision modifier on them, striking them over any other unit when within range, regardless of health values.
When there are multiple enemies with the vision modifier within the radius, the storm chooses between them randomly on each strike.

The strikes are neither regular attacks nor instant attacks, so they fully ignore effects such as evasion and Damage Block. This also means that they cannot trigger the on-attack effects of Counter Helix, Moment of Courage and Reactive Armor or break enemy Tranquil Boots. The strikes first deal their damage and then apply the armor reduction.
This also means that they cannot trigger the on-attack effects of Counter Helix, Moment of Courage and Reactive Armor or break enemy Tranquil Boots.
The strikes first deal their damage and then apply the armor reduction.
The armor reduction debuff on units lasts as long as the storm, or until Razor dies.
Does not affect Couriers, Roshan, invisible units and units in the Fog of War.
Eye of the Storm can strike up to 42/50/60 (TagTalent 50/60/75) times and deal up to 2520/3750/5400 (TagTalent 3000/4500/6750) damage per target (before reductions).
When Razor turns invisible, Eye of the Storm and its strike turn invisible as well, but still strike nearby enemies without them seeing or hearing them.
Eye of the Storm immediately ends when Razor dies.

With Aghanim's Scepter, does not reduce the armor of buildings, only the damage is applied. Prioritizes units over buildings and fully ignores filler buildings. It also allows it to strike 2 targets at the same time on each interval. An enemy may only be hit by one strike at a time, so a lone target is not hit multiple times per instance. This also goes for the level 25 talent, which allows it to strike 2 targets as well, or 3, together with Aghanim's Scepter.
Prioritizes units over buildings and fully ignores filler buildings.
It also allows it to strike 2 targets at the same time on each interval.
An enemy may only be hit by one strike at a time, so a lone target is not hit multiple times per instance.
This also goes for the level 25 talent, which allows it to strike 2 targets as well, or 3, together with Aghanim's Scepter.
abilities.description: A powerful lightning storm strikes out at enemy units with the lowest health, dealing damage and reducing their armor.
params: Causes Eye of the Storm to strike two different units instead of one and can damage structures. When striking buildings, it will only target towers, barracks, and the Ancient.

description: Razor, the Lightning Revenant, is a ranged agility hero who works as a position-based tank/carry that employs his abilities to deal massive damage in a relatively short amount of time, chase down the fleeing injured with his speed, and inflict debuffs on more powerful foes. Razor prefers to keep his position or kite his enemies allowing his spells to unleash its full potential. Known for being a speedy and a great anti-carry hero, Razor specializes in using his opponent's own powers against them, draining them of their damage and using it to smite them, as well as damaging and slowing targets that focus their abilities on him. His ultimate, Eye of the Storm, further enhances his carry-killing powers by inflicting constant, armor-shattering, lightning strikes on the foe with the lowest health within a radius. For those who rely on their pure brute force alone to fight, there is truly no escape from the Underscape.
history: Among the emblematic powers that populate the Underscape, Razor the Lightning Revenant is one of the most feared. With his whip of lightning, he patrols the Narrow Maze, that treacherous webwork of passages by which the souls of the dead are sorted according to their own innate intelligence, cunning and persistence. Drifting above the Maze, Razor looks down on the baffled souls below, and delivers jolts of scalding electricity that both punish and quicken the souls as they decide their own fates, hurrying on toward luminous exits or endlessly dark pits. Razor is the eternal embodiment of a dominating power, abstract and almost clinical in his application of power. Yet he has a lordly air that suggests he takes a sardonic satisfaction in his work.

talents.talentLeft: -0.1 Eye of the Storm Strike Interval
